node.title: ‘The Lost City’ and a Richard Linklater Film Will Play SXSW
node.alt: From left, Brad Pitt, Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum in “The Lost City.”
node.description: The film festival will return to primarily in-person screenings in Austin, Texas, with some online options.
node.content: ["Moon landings, multiverses and the movie-star musings of Nicolas Cage will all be a part of this year\u2019s South by Southwest Film Festival lineup, organizers announced Wednesday.", "Among the offerings at the Austin, Texas, festival is \u201cThe Lost City\u201d from Adam Nee and Aaron Nee, starring Sandra Bullock as a romance novelist who ends up on a \u201cRomancing the Stone\u201d-style adventure with Channing Tatum.", "Another action film on the roster is \u201cThe Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent,\u201d featuring Cage as himself, contemplating his career.", "Opening the festival will be \u201cEverything Everywhere All at Once,\u201d from the writing-directing team Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert (a.k.a. Daniels) and starring Michelle Yeoh in a sci-fi thriller that involves taxes and multiverses.", "Also in the mix is \u201cApollo 10 \u00bd: A Space Age Childhood\u201d from the Austin director Richard Linklater. The period coming-of-age film takes place in the suburbs of Houston the summer of the Apollo 11 moon landing.", "The festival, set for March 11-20, will primarily be held in person, with some online options. In 2020, it was one of the first major events to cancel because of the pandemic, and the following year it was turned into a virtual event."]
